settingsPane.description: Here you can switch STweaks settings to be applyed on BOOT or not.
settingsPane.name: Global BOOT Settings

spinner.description: Master Switch, Load All settings from all TABS on boot or not! default is LOAD.
spinner.name: Enable On Boot

spinnerItem.name: Don't load all Settings on boot

button.description: Push to load all tuned settings IF master switch is OFF or was OFF, if was ON when phone booted then no need to push!! wait till you see that settings are loaded
button.name: LOAD ALL
button.label: LOAD ALL

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune CPU functions in kernel
settingsPane.name: CPU Tuning

spinner.description: Control Over MAX allowed CPU frequency! here you can have normal 2.3GHz max or higher OC up to 2.8GHz! or you can limit to only 2.0GHz for battery save, when you set the value here all other apps or services can't set freq higher! so if you want more come here and change
spinner.name: OC Max Freq Control

spinner.description: CPU HotPlug Control, you can switch from OLD LG Default HotPlug driver to MSM HotPlug, IntelliHotPlug or Alucard driver, note that using Intelli CPU Thermal control with Default LG HotPlug is not recommended! low performance
spinner.name: HotPlug Driver

spinner.description: CPU ECO Mode, if ECO set, then only 2 cores can be ON, if STRICT set, then only 1 core can be ON, this will reduce performance but will save battery, depend on one of the custom HOTPLUGS, default not support this
spinner.name: Intelli ECO Mode

spinner.description: CPU Thermal control, Can be Default driver without controls, or Intelli thermal driver with controls below, its will limit CPU frequency when CPU reach the max limit heat, till cooled and restore full power, this can help with too hot phone playing games! intelli driver is more aggressive and drop freq to 1.4 then to 1.2 then to 1.1GHz that will reduce performance in all bench apps! Default will lock on 1.9GHz most of the time, and burn the fingers but give you more SCORE to show off.
spinner.name: CPU Temp Control

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable CPU Cores ON and OFF based on Cores HEAT set below, if OFF! then all cores work but get low freq on high temp! if ON! then cores turned off to help with CPU cooling, but loose performance! very bad for bench show off apps! but good for heat stability
checkbox.name: CPU Core Controls
checkbox.label: CPU Cores Control

seekBar.description: Here you can change CORES max HEAT before turning OFF cores from 3 to 1 and keep normal phone heat, if you tune above CPU max TEMP below, then all cores will stay ON when over heatted! This will work only with Intelli Temp Control ON!!!
seekBar.name: CORE Max Heat

seekBar.description: Here you can change CPU max HEAT before throttled down to cool and keep normal phone heat, depend on CPU Thermal control ON!
seekBar.name: CPU Max Heat

spinner.description: This will set the CPU governor. Default CPU governor will only be set during early stages of booting (before init.d execution), and can be overridden by any other scripts or applications.
spinner.name: Default CPU Governor

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable CPU-Tweaks below! if ON then kernel will obey only STweaks and set the below freqs on screen OFF and ON
checkbox.name: CPU-Tweaks
checkbox.label: CPU-Tweaks

spinner.description: Maximum CPU-Speed. You can tune the MAX CPU frequency, DEPEND ON CPU-Tweaks ON ABOVE! (Default: 2265600 kHz)
spinner.name: Max CPU Frequency

spinner.description: Minimum CPU-Speed. You can tune the MIN CPU frequency, MIN frequency can't be higher than MAX frequency!, DEPEND ON CPU-Tweaks ON ABOVE! (Default: 300000 kHz)
spinner.name: Min CPU Frequency

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune IO settings managed by Kernel
settingsPane.name: IO Tuning

spinner.description: Maximum number of kilobytes to read-ahead for SDCARD! Best to leave it 1024KB, default is 1024kB
spinner.name: kilobytes to read-ahead

spinner.description: This will set the default AWAKE IO scheduler for internal storage. (Default: ROW)
spinner.name: Default Awake IO Scheduler

spinner.description: This will set the DEEPSLEEP IO scheduler for internal storage. (Default: ROW) Depends on CortexBrain-Background-Process !!!
spinner.name: DEEPSLEEP IO Scheduler

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune memory and OOM (low mem management) settings managed by Kernel.
settingsPane.name: Memory Tuning

checkbox.description: Enable AUTO OOM control using below profiles, disable if you want to set your own OOM tuning via APP or Script.
checkbox.name: Auto OOM
checkbox.label: Auto OOM Control

spinner.description: Here you can set the level of low mem management by kernel lowmemkiller function. More aggressive, equals more free RAM but more killed apps.
spinner.name: OOM Level Screen ON

spinner.description: Here you can set the level of low mem management by kernel lowmemkiller function. More aggressive equals more free RAM but more killed apps.
spinner.name: OOM Level Screen OFF

seekBar.description: Dirty background memory buffer, more you set, more memory will be used for write buffer for background operations. Buffer is released on need to free RAM (Default: 20%)
seekBar.name: Dirty Background ratio

seekBar.description: Dirty real time memory buffer, more you set, more memory will be used for write buffer for real time operations. Buffer is released on need to free RAM (Default: 40%)
seekBar.name: Dirty ratio

button.description: Clean RAM Cache. This will release all cached and buffered RAM, please WAIT 3sec to get cleanup report
button.name: CLEAN RAM CACHE
button.label: CLEAN RAM CACHE NOW

settingsPane.description: Here you can activate some scripts, which will automatically run in the background, at a specified time.
settingsPane.name: cron

spinner.description: Main switch for Cron Tasker. If you set this to OFF, then all tasks below have no effect!
spinner.name: CRON TASK MAIN SWITCH

button.description: Use this button to test if this Cron Task service is ONLINE and supported! If main switch is ON, and service is OFFLINE, then ROM Busybox is not supporting Cron. Update Busybox or ROM for this to work.
button.name: Test Cron Task Service
button.label: Test Cron Task Service

button.description: Use this button to RESET the scripts and jobs from kernel, to refresh the configuration. This will clear all your custom changes!
button.name: CRON RESET
button.label: RESET CRON

checkbox.description: Cron to clear file-cache every hour, but only if CPU is resting (IDLE) and more than 50% of your memory is used! This will free RAM from unused buffers and cache.
checkbox.name: Clean file-cache
checkbox.label: RAM cache clean every Hour

checkbox.description: Cron to update AD-BLOCKER every week at SAT 6:00AM UTC time, from official site. The script will check, if you are connected with the internet, otherwise it will try to use WIFI! Script will turn wifi, wait for connection and update, then when it is finished it will turn WIFI off. If there is no connection, an error will be written in the log.
checkbox.name: Update AD-Block
checkbox.label: Update AD-BLOCKER every week

checkbox.description: Cron to DB Optimize every day at 3:00AM, only if CPU is resting (IDLE)!
checkbox.name: DB Optimization
checkbox.label: DB Optimization task every day at 3:00AM

checkbox.description: Cron to clear app-cache every day at 4:00AM, only if CPU is resting (IDLE)!
checkbox.name: Clean app-cache
checkbox.label: Disk Clean task every day at 4:00AM

checkbox.description: Cron to zipalign app is every day at 4:50AM, only if CPU is resting (IDLE)! This can help to reduce errors, bugs, applications FC, and improve applications load speed. WARNING! Bakcup all apps before use! This process will remove apps that are BROKEN and not compressed or compiled correctly, so you may find some apps missing! USE it AT YOUR OWN RISK and update the broken applications!
checkbox.name: Zipalign Task
checkbox.label: Zipalign Task Every day at 4:50AM

button.description: Use this button to check if Cron Task Jobs are done as requested. This will show the log for all finished jobs.
button.name: Test Cron Task jobs
button.label: Test Cron Task Jobs

settingsPane.description: Here you can find some settings and options for your apps.
settingsPane.name: Apps

button.description: Click here to start Zipaligning ONLY user apps. System may be unresponsive, it is OK, do not use phone for 2 minutes. WARNING! Backup all user applications before use! This process will remove applications that are BROKEN and not compressed or compiled correctly, so you may find some apps missing. USE it AT YOUR OWN RISK, and update the broken applications!.
button.name: ZIPALIGN
button.label: ZIPALIGN ALL APPS

button.description: Click here to start applications Database Optimization. Compacting, cleaning and indexing will take max 2min.
button.name: DB OPTIMIZATION
button.label: DATABASE OPTIMIZATON

button.description: Clean WIFI DHCP IP Lease. Push the button to activate!
button.name: Clean WIFI Lease
button.label: Clean WIFI Lease

settingsPane.description: Here you can find GPS and NTP settings and options.
settingsPane.name: GPS - NTP

spinner.description: GPS-Time-Zone for faster GPS lock! Use your region!
spinner.name: GPS Region

button.description: Click to see your current GPS ZONE
button.name: GPS ZONE
button.label: GPS ZONE CHECK

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable INIT.D scripts RUN on boot. Many new ROMS are running the init.d scripts automatically. You can also force running the scripts, but if you run them and ROM runs them too, we have a problem: all scripts are running X2 times! To avoid conflicts, STweaks RUN-control is disabled by default. If you know that your ROM is NOT supporting init.d script running, then turn it ON here and reboot.
checkbox.name: INIT.D Scripts RUN control
checkbox.label: Enable INIT.D scripts RUN-control

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable Android Additional Logs (needs reboot)
checkbox.name: Android Logger
checkbox.label: Android Logger

settingsPane.description: Fast charge control menu, here you can set the force FAST charge option when MTP is used as USB connection!
settingsPane.name: Fast Charge Control

spinner.description: Fast Charge ON or OFF, also you can force charge voltage limit! for this select manual and set below the requested limit, if set here ON then default limit is 1200mA, if your charger can't give you that, don't expect to see 1200mA charge, no magic here.
spinner.name: Force Fast Charge Switch

spinner.description: Fast Charge Manual voltage limit! here you can set the max allowed voltage when using charger. Take effect ONLY if Fast Charge Manual is set above!
spinner.name: Fast Charge Voltage Limits

checkbox.description: Enable one more Force Fast Charge HACK to mask any charger including USB as AC power. so we always get fast charge mode! no more SLOW CHARGE Icon! The side effect is that you get 2 connections sound and vibrate! one for USB connected and second for AC connected!
checkbox.name: Fake AC Charger
checkbox.label: Fake AC Charger Hack

checkbox.description: Enable Sweep2Sleep function that allow to turn screen off sweeping from right to left or backwards on bottom of the screen! If you have removed the soft buttons bar, then you have to turn this function OFF!
checkbox.name: Sweep2Sleep Control
checkbox.label: Sweep2Sleep

settingsPane.description: This script will manipulate many kernel settings, based on chosen STweaks profile + settings and on screen state (ON or OFF) and we call it CortexBrain. To reset the kernel-settings, after you disable a tweak, you must reboot!
settingsPane.name: CortexBrain Tweaks

spinner.description: Enable or Disable the background-process from CortexBrain. If you disable it, you will lose the function that set different settings for screen state (ON or OFF).
spinner.name: Cortexbrain-Background-Process

button.description: Click to see if the CortexBrain-Background-Process is running or not.
button.name: Check Background-Process
button.label: CHECK SERVICE

settingsPane.description: You can check what profile is used right now.
settingsPane.name: Online Profile

button.description: This displays your currently used profile.
button.name: Profile Check
button.label: Profile Check

settingsPane.description: Here you can choose some profiles. You can also switch the default profiles (battery, default, performance) via Kernel-Recovery.
settingsPane.name: STweaks Profiles

settingsPane.description: Here you can backup or restore your profile after installing new kernel. When you restore your configuration, please wait till this app restarts with the new settings. Some settings will work only after reboot! Restore will take up to 30 sec, just wait here!
settingsPane.name: STweaks Settings Backup or Restore

settingsPane.description: Here you can load on boot kernel modules that will allow some extra functions.
settingsPane.name: Kernel Modules

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable CIFS Module. This will allow to use apps that can mount internal storage and publish over network. User can access data and system over network. No support, effect only after reboot!
checkbox.name: CIFS Module
checkbox.label: CIFS Module
